t: Matthew 12
Lord of the Sabbath
At*p that time Jesus passed through the grainfields on the Sabbath. His disciples were hungry and began to pick and eat some heads of grain.
When the Pharisees saw this, they said to him, “See, your disciples are doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath.”
He*p said to them, “Haven’t*r you*r read*r what*r David*r did*r when*r he*r and*r those*r who*r were*r with*r him*r were*r hungry:*r

how*r he*r entered*r the*r house*r of*r God,*r and*r they*r ate*r the*r bread*r of*r the*r Presence — which*r is*r not*r lawful*r for*r him*r or*r for*r those*r with*r him*r to*r eat,*r but*r only*r for*r the*r priests?*r
Or*r haven’t*r you*r read*r in*r the*r law*r that*r on*r Sabbath*r days*r the*r priests*r in*r the*r temple*r violate*r the*r Sabbath*r and*r are*r innocent?*r
I*r tell*r you*r that*r something*r greater*r than*r the*r temple*r is*r here.*r
If*r you*r had*r known*r what*r this*r means,*r I*ir desire*ir mercy*ir and*ir not*ir sacrifice,*ir you*r would*r not*r have*r condemned*r the*r innocent.*r
For*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r Lord*r of*r the*r Sabbath.”*r
The Man with the Shriveled Hand
Moving*p on from there, he entered their synagogue.
There he saw a man who had a shriveled hand, and in order to accuse him they asked him, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”
He*p replied to them, “Who*r among*r you,*r if*r he*r had*r a*r sheep*r that*r fell*r into*r a*r pit*r on*r the*r Sabbath,*r wouldn’t*r take*r hold*r of*r it*r and*r lift*r it*r out?*r
A*r person*r is*r worth*r far*r more*r than*r a*r sheep;*r so*r it*r is*r lawful*r to*r do*r what*r is*r good*r on*r the*r Sabbath.”*r
Then*p he told the man, “Stretch*r out*r your*r hand.”*r So he stretched it out, and it was restored, as good as the other.
But the Pharisees went out and plotted against him, how they might kill him.
The Servant of the Lord
Jesus*p was aware of this and withdrew. Large crowds followed him, and he healed them all.
He warned them not to make him known,
so that what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah might be fulfilled:

He*iln will*i not*i break*i a*i bruised*i reed,*i and*iln he*i will*i not*i put*i out*i a*i smoldering*i wick,*i until*iln he*i has*i led*i justice*i to*i victory.*i
The*iln nations*i will*i put*i their*i hope*i in*i his*i name.*i
A House Divided
Then*p a demon-possessed man who was blind and unable to speak was brought to him. He healed him, so that the man could both speak and see.
All the crowds were astounded and said, “Could this be the Son of David?”
When*p the Pharisees heard this, they said, “This man drives out demons only by Beelzebul, the ruler of the demons.”
Knowing*p their thoughts, he told them, “Every*r kingdom*r divided*r against*r itself*r is*r headed*r for*r destruction,*r and*r no*r city*r or*r house*r divided*r against*r itself*r will*r stand.*r
If*r Satan*r drives*r out*r Satan,*r he*r is*r divided*r against*r himself.*r How*r then*r will*r his*r kingdom*r stand?*r
And*r if*r I*r drive*r out*r demons*r by*r Beelzebul,*r by*r whom*r do*r your*r sons*r drive*r them*r out?*r For*r this*r reason*r they*r will*r be*r your*r judges.*r
If*r I*r drive*r out*r demons*r by*r the*r Spirit*r of*r God,*r then*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r has*r come*r upon*r you.*r
How*r can*r someone*r enter*r a*r strong*r man’s*r house*r and*r steal*r his*r possessions*r unless*r he*r first*r ties*r up*r the*r strong*r man?*r Then*r he*r can*r plunder*r his*r house.*r
Anyone*r who*r is*r not*r with*r me*r is*r against*r me,*r and*r anyone*r who*r does*r not*r gather*r with*r me*r scatters.*r
Therefore,*r I*r tell*r you,*r people*r will*r be*r forgiven*r every*r sin*r and*r blasphemy,*r but*r the*r blasphemy*r against*r the*r Spirit*r will*r not*r be*r forgiven.*r

Whoever*r speaks*r a*r word*r against*r the*r Son*r of*r Man,*r it*r will*r be*r forgiven*r him;*r but*r whoever*r speaks*r against*r the*r Holy*r Spirit,*r it*r will*r not*r be*r forgiven*r him,*r either*r in*r this*r age*r or*r in*r the*r one*r to*r come.*r

A*r good*r person*r produces*r good*r things*r from*r his*r storeroom*r of*r good,*r and*r an*r evil*r person*r produces*r evil*r things*r from*r his*r storeroom*r of*r evil.*r

For*r by*r your*r words*r you*r will*r be*r acquitted,*r and*r by*r your*r words*r you*r will*r be*r condemned.”*r
The Sign of Jonah

An Unclean Spirit’s Return
“When*rp an*r unclean*r spirit*r comes*r out*r of*r a*r person,*r it*r roams*r through*r waterless*r places*r looking*r for*r rest*r but*r doesn’t*r find*r any.*r
Then*r it*r says,*r ‘I’ll*r go*r back*r to*r my*r house*r that*r I*r came*r from.’*r Returning,*r it*r finds*r the*r house*r vacant,*r swept,*r and*r put*r in*r order.*r

True Relationships
While*p he was still speaking with the crowds, his mother and brothers were standing outside wanting to speak to him.
Someone told him, “Look, your mother and your brothers are standing outside, wanting to speak to you.”
He*p replied to the one who was speaking to him, “Who*r is*r my*r mother*r and*r who*r are*r my*r brothers?”*r
Stretching out his hand toward his disciples, he said, “Here*r are*r my*r mother*r and*r my*r brothers!*r
For*r whoever*r does*r the*r will*r of*r my*r Father*r in*r heaven*r is*r my*r brother*r and*r sister*r and*r mother.”*r
